label: Description
value: Fragment from an altar frontal in coarse cream-colored linen embroidered in silk in red, light green, light blue, and white. In the center field, the Crucifixion: Christ on the cross with bowed head, with blood dripping from the hands and three red cuts across the body. A figure appears on each side, possibly St. John the Baptist on the right and Mary with a sword at her breast on the left; both figures wear long straight robes with simple geometric patterns. Christ's face appears to be re-worked, and that of St. John is very worn. With a deep border of curving vines with three-lobed leaves. At corners are winged beasts with tails (wyverns).

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and linen embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in satin and stem stitches on plain weave Label: linen embroidered with linen and silk in satin and stem stitches

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase in memory of Elizabeth Haynes

label: Description
value: Horizontal view of with the figure of an unconscious woman supported by a seaman, at center, being pulled to shore by means of breeches buoy.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Erskine Hewitt

label: Description
value: Narrow border of blue silk embroidered in gold, silver and pale tints of silk. Design is a curving vine with a symmetrical arrangement of small carnation in profile. Trimmed with very narrow metal edging on top and bottom. Bottom has a fringe of green silk and gold thread.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value:
Globular body with double C-scroll handle and curving animal-headed spout. Round lid with bud-form knob. Gilt enrichments. Painted floral elements. In open gilt frame is painted Mercury appearing to a female figure. 
Impressed marks: diagonal lozenges on a shield (the Bavarian “Rautenschild”) and III in a circle

label: Physical description
value: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold

label: Provenance
value: Labels on bottom show that this piece was formerly in the collection of Archduke Ludwig Viktor of Hapsburg, at Schloss Klessheim, near Salzburg; and of F. Neuburg, at Litoměřice, Czech Republic.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Folding fan with a leaf of white bobbin lace with swirling floral patterns. Sticks of plain mother-of-pearl, with a wide white silk ribbon.

label: Physical description
value: Linen bobbin lace leaf, mother-of-pearl sticks, silk ribbon

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (without ribbon): 25.4 × 43.8 cm (10 in. × 17 1/4 in.) H x W (with ribbon): 50.8 × 43.8 cm (20 in. × 17 1/4 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1949: Lester C. Danielson; 1949: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Accordion-pleated stiff paper folder with front board cover with dark imitation pebbled leather printed in gold, "Compliments of the New York Watering Co., Printing, Moiré, Re-dyeing and Finishing." Contains numbered samples, stapled to pages, of metallic trimmings that are stamped, woven and printed in imitation of chiné designs.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: paper, cotton, silk, metallic thread

label: Description
value: Notebook with dark leather corners and back, with board covers covered with polychrome marbled paper, and plain pages on which are pasted 94 wide ribbon samples in polychrome and white silk, and one section of coarse cotton cloth printed with roses. Samples include chine, satin stripes, satin printed, fancy cloth, ribbed cloth, printed cotton.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D: 35.5 x 24.5 cm (14 x 9 5/8 in.) 184 pages
